channel.title: Dragon-History!
channel.description: Ok guys, I have another problem that I need to fix. DO NOT SPOONFEED ME! Ok, the problem is that on the dragon-history source, everytime i walk, i lag. Not terrible lag, but when i walk like 1 or 2 steps, the game lags and stops a for a second, then continues. Can somebody please tell me what is wrong and what do I need to look for to fix it?!?

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Oh yes, I forgot. Too many NPCs will lag the server and that’s what will happen. This commonly happens in a DeltaScape server.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @stoneboyjosh stoneboyjosh
item.description:
@stoneboyjosh wrote:

I will try a new client, then if that doesn’t work, i will try a new source with the same client. do you think it could be because of a lot of stuff packed into the server?

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Aah, the buffer size is fine, so the next part is one of the two remaining options I said above.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @stoneboyjosh stoneboyjosh
item.description:
@stoneboyjosh wrote:

I have no idea what arrays are…lol. I am seriously a nooby at coding. Its like my 2nd day. I can do basic stuff, but I can’t add skills, mess with arrrays…lol. So your gonna have to use newbie coder talk. lolz. Sorry for being such and noob. i just clicked the rep++ under your name if that helps

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

Process your packets faster.

Loading them via arrays is the best way.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @stoneboyjosh stoneboyjosh
item.description:
@stoneboyjosh wrote:

Lolz. I am so sorry that I’m a noob. Now I think I found it.

	outStream = new stream(new byte[bufferSize]);
	outStream.currentOffset = 0;
	inStream = new stream(new byte[bufferSize]);
	inStream.currentOffset = 0;

If this is it, what do I need to do?

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

No. It should look like

inStream = new stream[thesizehere];

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @stoneboyjosh stoneboyjosh
item.description:
@stoneboyjosh wrote:

Hmm…I found this…
try {
misc.println(“ClientHandler: Client " + playerName
+ " disconnected (” + connectedFrom + “)”);
disconnected = true;
if (saveNeeded)
savegame(true);
if (in != null) {
in.close();
}
if (out != null) {
out.close();
}
mySock = null;
in = null;
out = null;
inStream = null;
outStream = null;
isActive = false;
synchronized (this) {
notify();
Is this it?

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

No, client.java. Look for "inStream = new ".

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @stoneboyjosh stoneboyjosh
item.description:
@stoneboyjosh wrote:

Ok, I’m going a bit noobish on you here :D, but instream and outstream would be in the stream.java file right?? Cause that’s where I’m looking and I’m not seeing anything like buffersize or 100 or 5000.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Go for it. I didn’t figure this out, or try it, but it has been proven to cause this problem and fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @stoneboyjosh stoneboyjosh
item.description:
@stoneboyjosh wrote:

Ok, I know for sure that my process system is not messed up. I have a pretty good feeling about the buffer size being set on 100 and not 5000 though. Should I go change it if it is not on 5000?

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon-History!
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Your process system might be messed up, the server or client might be lagging badly in some parts, or (From what JaydenD12 has found out, and proven to fix), when the two streams (inStream and outStream) are set, they’re not using the set bufferSize, which should be 5000, but are using 100.

Read full topic
